definition[0]: a practicable way of doing something is possible in a particular situation
example[0]: The only practicable course of action is to sell the company.
example[1]: It is their duty to ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, that the equipment is safe.
example[2]: It may not always be practicable to follow exactly the recommendations.
note[0]: it is practicable (for somebody) to do something
